snippet: A decision to impose across-the-board losses on Cypriot depositors as part of a $13 billion bailout has fueled fears that bank runs there could spread to countries like Spain and Italy.
abstract: Europe’s surprising decision to impose taxes on bank depositors in Cyprus as part of euro zone's $13 billion bailout sets off increasing outrage and turmoil, fueling fears that bank runs there could spread to countries like Spain and Italy; severe terms of bailout, which is unlikely to be approved by Cyprus' Parliament, appear to be driven by growing reluctance of wealthy European nations to finance their fiscally troubled neighbors.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Nicosia, Cyprus, and Landon Thomas Jr. from London.

lead_paragraph: A decision to impose across-the-board losses on Cypriot depositors as part of a $13 billion bailout has fueled fears that bank runs there could spread to countries like Spain and Italy.

headline.seo: Cyprus Delays Bailout Vote, Fueling Euro Zone Turmoil
headline.main:
Turmoil in Cyprus
Over a Bailout
Rattles Europe
headline.print_headline: Cyprus Turmoil Over a Bailout Rattles Europe
